definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The character was obviously wrong but he didn't pick it out. It shows how careless he was.
sentences.chinese: 這麼明顯的錯字他都沒看出來，可見他很粗心。

sentences.english: Why do you always miswrite the words?
Sorry, I just misspelled my handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，我剛纔打錯字了。

sentences.english: What if there's a mistake with my handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 如果我寫錯字了怎麼辦。

sentences.english: That's no typo. It's $40 a month.
sentences.chinese: 我可沒有打錯字，就是每月40美元。

sentences.english: Your poem was well written except for a wrong word.
sentences.chinese: 除了一個錯字外，你的詩寫得很好。

sentences.english: The confusion about the date of the meeting arose from a tying error.
sentences.chinese: 開會日期的混亂是因爲打錯字英語口語培訓造成的。

sentences.english: Please ---------- the wrong word in the sentence.
This way the player can quickly notice a typo.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，玩家可以很快看到一個錯字。

sentences.english: Mark the wrong word with a circle.

definition: simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
